Desc: Built for exploring. It has high endurance, a decent sized crew compartment, and can hold some high-grade Equipment.
Designed for autonomous tactical operations. It can't hold a big crew or cargo, but can carry strong weapons, engine and shields.
Stripped of everything possible to increase cargo space. Not built to defend itself, it is the favourite target for space pirates.
Usually used for invasions, it can be used for exploring as well, especially on planets with many hostile lifeforms.
Science comes first with combat running a close second for the heavy scout. The perfect ship to operate far away from home.
Patrolduty was the design goal for the cruiser. Good endurance combined with considerable firepower was the result.
Its firepower won't impress most pirates, but it might be able to defend itself long enough to flee.
Designed to deliver a good amount of troops in hostile territory. Some armament ensures that they actually reach the ground.
Bigger Crew quarters, higher endurance and good offensive weapons make the Explorer the vessel of choice for long term surveys of distant stars.
Not many ships can face a destroyer in combat. It also can load enough fuel to get it where it's needed and deliver a considerable amount of ground troops.
While still an easy target without escorts, smaller pirate ships might think twice about attacking it.
A good contingent of this shiptype would be a part of any invasion fleet. Some ship to ship capabilites ensure that its payload reaches the ground.
The ultimate workhorse for exploration. Built for long term and long range missions in hostile territory.
A spacecombat powerhouse. Designed to obliterate enemy fleets. It's only weak point is its low endurance, making long missions difficult.
The armed Merchantman relies on its own firepower to drive away those who want its cargo.
Designed to deliver huge landing parties. Decent ship to ship capabilities enable it to operate without escorts protecting it.
